publication_name.en: Invited talk, Proc.3rd China-Japan Joint Symposium on "Recent Topics in Nuclear Physics"eds.H.Orihara and K.Ikeda

paper_title.en: Inhomogeneous big-bang model, revived, and evolution of the light elements in cosmic rays

description.en: Inhomogeneous big-bang model for primordial nucleosynthesis allows higher universal mass density parameter of baryons than the standard homogeneous model does, which is marginally consistent with recent astronomical suggestion that some kind of dark matter is made of baryons. Observation of the enhanced heavy elements in metal weak dwarfs is proposed to test the inhomogeneous model. The studies of radioactive nuclear reactions help predict the theoretical abundances more precisely. © 1995.
